summary:
2.0       Date of publication:2019-10-13
Notes:
A number of amendments were made based on user feedback. New code PoliticalAdministrativeArea added. New code MediaUnit and its subterms added. TextUnit was made a narrower term in the MediaUnit hierarchy. Several code definitions and the vocabulary definition were amended for clarity. Usage information updated.
Changes:
CV definition amended Code added: PoliticalAdministrativeArea Code added: MediaUnit Code added: MediaUnit.Sound Code added: MediaUnit.StillImage Code added: MediaUnit.Video Code value changed: TextUnit changed to MediaUnit.Text Code value changed: Organization changed to OrganizationOrInstitution Code value changed: EventOrProcess changed to EventOrProcessOrActivity Code descriptive term rephrased: Organization rephrased into Organization/Institution Code descriptive term rephrased: Housing Unit rephrased into Housing unit Code descriptive term rephrased: Event/Process rephrased into Event/Process/Activity Code descriptive term rephrased: Geographic Unit rephrased into Geographic unit Code descriptive term rephrased: Time Unit rephrased into Time unit Code descriptive term rephrased: Text Unit rephrased into Media unit: Text Code definition rephrased: Individual Code definition rephrased: OrganizationOrInstitution Code definition rephrased: Family Code definition rephrased: Family.HouseholdFamily Code definition rephrased: EventOrProcessOrActivity Code definition rephrased: Geographic unit Code definition rephrased: MediaUnit.Text Code definition rephrased: Group

1.0       Date of publication:2019-04-02
Notes:
title: Analysis Unit
definition: Describes the entity being observed or analyzed in the study or in the variable.
notes: This vocabulary was first published by the DDI Alliance. Please see: https://ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies/all.
versionNotes: A number of amendments were made based on user feedback. New code PoliticalAdministrativeArea added. New code MediaUnit and its subterms added. TextUnit was made a narrower term in the MediaUnit hierarchy. Several code definitions and the vocabulary definition were amended for clarity. Usage information updated.
versionChanges:
CV definition amended
Code added: PoliticalAdministrativeArea
Code added: MediaUnit
Code added: MediaUnit.Sound
Code added: MediaUnit.StillImage
Code added: MediaUnit.Video
Code value changed: TextUnit changed to MediaUnit.Text
Code value changed: Organization changed to OrganizationOrInstitution
Code value changed: EventOrProcess changed to EventOrProcessOrActivity
Code descriptive term rephrased: Organization rephrased into Organization/Institution
Code descriptive term rephrased: Housing Unit rephrased into Housing unit
Code descriptive term rephrased: Event/Process rephrased into Event/Process/Activity
Code descriptive term rephrased: Geographic Unit rephrased into Geographic unit
Code descriptive term rephrased: Time Unit rephrased into Time unit
Code descriptive term rephrased: Text Unit rephrased into Media unit: Text
Code definition amended with meaning change: OrganizationOrInstitution
Code definition amended with meaning change: EventOrProcessOrActivity
Code definition rephrased: Individual
Code definition rephrased: Family
Code definition rephrased: Family.HouseholdFamily
Code definition rephrased: Geographic unit
Code definition rephrased: MediaUnit.Text
Code definition rephrased: Group
citation: DDI Alliance. (2019). Analysis Unit (Version 2.0) [Controlled vocabulary]. CESSDA. urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:AnalysisUnit:2.0.
ddiUsage:
DDI 3.2
Module Name: reusable
Element Name: AnalysisUnit

DDI 2.5
Element/Attribute Name: anlyUnit@unit
Element/Attribute Name: anlysUnit

Group.title: Group
Group.definition: Two or more individuals assembled together or having some unifying relationship or characteristic. In surveys, the questions are mainly focused on the group and the attitudes/experiences of the group, rather than on those of the individual respondents. If questions cover both the group and the individual, use  both as analysis units.

MediaUnit.Video.title: Media unit: Video
MediaUnit.Video.definition: Moving images. May include films, animation, digital recordings, visual output from simulations, recorded television programs, diagnostic/medical videos like ultrasound scans, etc. May be mute or may include synchronized sound.

PoliticalAdministrativeArea.title: Political-administrative area
PoliticalAdministrativeArea.definition: A geographical area governed by a sovereign authority that has the power to take administrative or policy decisions for that area. This includesÂ areas at the supranational (e.g., unions of states like the European Union),  national (e.g., individual states or countries), sub-national (e.g., administrative subdivisions like federal states, provinces, etc.), and local (e.g., municipalities) levels.

MediaUnit.Text.title: Media unit: Text
MediaUnit.Text.definition: Any written piece/entity, such as books, articles, tweets, blogs, etc. For example, a study on hate speech in tweets, or a study of the way newspapers present certain political/social issues over time, like women's or minorities' rights, etc.

OrganizationOrInstitution.title: Organization/Institution
OrganizationOrInstitution.definition: Any kind of formal administrative and functional structure - includes associations, institutions, agencies, businesses, political parties, schools, etc. The data are collected about the organizations or institutions, even if the questions are answered by individuals. For example, data on the environmental policies of businesses, data on enrollment or graduation rates at national universities, etc.

MediaUnit.Sound.title: Media unit: Sound
MediaUnit.Sound.definition: Recorded sound, including voice, music, etc.

Household.title: Household
Household.definition: A person or a group of persons who share the same dwelling unit and common living arrangements. These common living arrangements may include pooling some, or all, of their income and wealth, and consuming certain types of goods and services collectively, mainly housing and food (Eurostat).

Family.HouseholdFamily.title: Family: Household family
Family.HouseholdFamily.definition: A more specific term that refers only to people who are related through family ties (see definition for 'Family') and live in the same household at a point in time. If not known whether the analysis unit is 'Family' or 'Household family', use 'Family'.

HousingUnit.title: Housing unit
HousingUnit.definition: U.S. Census: A housing unit is a house, an apartment, a mobile home, a group of rooms, or a single room that is occupied (or if vacant, is intended for occupancy) as separate living quarters. Separate living quarters are those in which the occupants live and eat separately from any other persons in the building and which have direct access from the outside of the building or through a common hall.

GeographicUnit.title: Geographic unit
GeographicUnit.definition: Any entity that can be spatially defined as a geographic area, with either natural (physical) or administrative boundaries. For example, data on home sales, landscaping changes, new constructions, or changes in the demographic composition of certain regions or districts.

MediaUnit.title: Media unit
MediaUnit.definition: Includes text, still image, video and sound.

TimeUnit.title: Time unit
TimeUnit.definition: Any period of time: year, week, month, day, or bimonthly or quarterly periods, etc.

Family.title: Family
Family.definition: Two or more people related by blood, marriage (including step-relations), co-habitation or registered partnership, adoption or fostering, and who may or may not live together. For example, data on what kind of public services the family uses or would require; or how often family members are in contact with each other.

MediaUnit.StillImage.title: Media unit: Still image
MediaUnit.StillImage.definition: Static images, such as graphs, drawings, photographs, diagnostic/medical images like X-rays and other types of imaging tests, etc.

Object.title: Object
Object.definition: Anything material, but inanimate, that has an independent existence and may be perceived by the senses. Examples: objects of art (paintings, sculptures, etc.) or weapons, or vehicles, etc.

Other.title: Other
Other.definition: Use if the unit of analysis is known, but not found in the list.

EventOrProcessOrActivity.title: Event/Process/Activity
EventOrProcessOrActivity.definition: Any type of incident, occurrence, or activity. Events are usually one-time, individual occurrences, with a limited or short duration. Examples: criminal offenses, riots, meetings, elections, sports competitions, terrorist attacks, natural disasters like floods, etc. Processes typically take place over time, and may include multiple 'events' or gradual changes that ultimately lead, or are projected to lead, to a particular result. Examples: court trials, criminal investigations, political campaigns, medical treatments, education, athletes' training, etc. Use when the main focus is more on the event, process or activity itself. For example, a field observation study on slot machine gambling; or data collected on child abuse cases, such as the type and duration of abuse, the role of the persons involved, etc.

1167.title: Organization/Institution
1167.definition: Any kind of formal administrative and functional structure - includes associations, institutions, agencies, businesses, political parties, schools, etc. The data are collected about the organizations or institutions, even if the questions are answered by individuals. For example, data on the environmental policies of businesses, data on enrollment or graduation rates at national universities, etc.

1177.definition: Anything material, but inanimate, that has an independent existence and may be perceived by the senses. Examples: objects of art (paintings, sculptures, etc.) or weapons, or vehicles, etc.

1178.title: Other
1178.definition: Use if the unit of analysis is known, but not found in the list.
